intro: Blakwellia gracilis, commonly known as the slender blakwellia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Blakwellia gracilis is often found in open woodlands and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
